analysis_objective: Analyze sales performance and identify opportunities for improvement

key_findings.finding: Strong positive correlation (0.97) between new_customers and repeat_customers
Strong positive correlation (0.97) between repeat_customers and new_customers
repeat_customers has a moderate impact on daily_sales (R² = 0.29). When repeat_customers increases, daily_sales typically increases.
new_customers has a moderate impact on daily_sales (R² = 0.27). When new_customers increases, daily_sales typically increases.
product_category segment 'Toys' has 378.4% higher profit_margin than segment 'Books'
product_category segment 'Toys' has 269.3% higher profit than segment 'Books'

recommendations.recommendation: Conduct deeper time-series analysis on daily_sales to understand factors driving the increasing trend
Conduct deeper time-series analysis on marketing_spend to understand factors driving the increasing trend
Investigate potential causal relationship between new_customers and repeat_customers
Analyze factors contributing to high profit_margin in product_category segment 'Toys'
Investigate identified outliers to determine if they represent data quality issues or valuable business exceptions
